name: Bundler/DuplicatedGem
description: Checks for duplicate gem entries in Gemfile.

name: Bundler/DuplicatedGroup
description: Checks for duplicate group entries in Gemfile.

name: Bundler/GemComment
description: Add a comment describing each gem.

name: Bundler/GemFilename
description: Enforces the filename for managing gems.

name: Bundler/GemVersion
description: Requires or forbids specifying gem versions.

name: Bundler/InsecureProtocolSource
description: The source `:gemcutter`, `:rubygems` and `:rubyforge` are deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure. Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible, or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

name: Bundler/OrderedGems
description: Gems within groups in the Gemfile should be alphabetically sorted.

name: Gemspec/AddRuntimeDependency
description: Prefer `add_dependency` over `add_runtime_dependency`.

name: Gemspec/AttributeAssignment
description: Use consistent style for Gemspec attributes assignment.

name: Gemspec/DependencyVersion
description: Requires or forbids specifying gem dependency versions.

name: Gemspec/DeprecatedAttributeAssignment
description: Checks that deprecated attribute assignments are not set in a gemspec file.

name: Gemspec/DevelopmentDependencies
description: Checks that development dependencies are specified in Gemfile rather than gemspec.

name: Gemspec/DuplicatedAssignment
description: An attribute assignment method calls should be listed only once in a gemspec.

name: Gemspec/OrderedDependencies
description: Dependencies in the gemspec should be alphabetically sorted.

name: Gemspec/RequireMFA
description: Checks that the gemspec has metadata to require Multi-Factor Authentication from RubyGems.

name: Gemspec/RequiredRubyVersion
description: Checks that `required_ruby_version` of gemspec is specified and equal to `TargetRubyVersion` of .rubocop.yml.

name: Gemspec/RubyVersionGlobalsUsage
description: Checks usage of RUBY_VERSION in gemspec.

name: Layout/AccessModifierIndentation
description: Checks indentation of private/protected visibility modifiers.

name: Layout/ArgumentAlignment
description: Align the arguments of a method call if they span more than one line.

name: Layout/ArrayAlignment
description: Align the elements of an array literal if they span more than one line.

name: Layout/AssignmentIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first line of the right-hand-side of a multi-line assignment.

name: Layout/BeginEndAlignment
description: Align ends corresponding to begins correctly.

name: Layout/BlockAlignment
description: Align block ends correctly.

name: Layout/BlockEndNewline
description: Put end statement of multiline block on its own line.

name: Layout/CaseIndentation
description: Indentation of when in a case/(when|in)/[else/]end.

name: Layout/ClassStructure
description: Enforces a configured order of definitions within a class body.

name: Layout/ClosingHeredocIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of here document closings.

name: Layout/ClosingParenthesisIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of hanging closing parentheses.

name: Layout/CommentIndentation
description: Indentation of comments.

name: Layout/ConditionPosition
description: Checks for condition placed in a confusing position relative to the keyword.

name: Layout/DefEndAlignment
description: Align ends corresponding to defs correctly.

name: Layout/DotPosition
description: Checks the position of the dot in multi-line method calls.

name: Layout/ElseAlignment
description: Align elses and elsifs correctly.

name: Layout/EmptyComment
description: Checks empty comment.

name: Layout/EmptyLineAfterGuardClause
description: Add empty line after guard clause.

name: Layout/EmptyLineAfterMagicComment
description: Add an empty line after magic comments to separate them from code.

name: Layout/EmptyLineAfterMultilineCondition
description: Enforces empty line after multiline condition.

name: Layout/EmptyLineBetweenDefs
description: Use empty lines between class/module/method defs.

name: Layout/EmptyLines
description: Don't use several empty lines in a row.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAfterModuleInclusion
description: Keeps track of empty lines after module inclusion methods.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundAccessModifier
description: Keep blank lines around access modifiers.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundArguments
description: Keeps track of empty lines around method arguments.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundAttributeAccessor
description: Keep blank lines around attribute accessors.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundBeginBody
description: Keeps track of empty lines around begin-end bodies.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundBlockBody
description: Keeps track of empty lines around block bodies.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundClassBody
description: Keeps track of empty lines around class bodies.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundExceptionHandlingKeywords
description: Keeps track of empty lines around exception handling keywords.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundMethodBody
description: Keeps track of empty lines around method bodies.

name: Layout/EmptyLinesAroundModuleBody
description: Keeps track of empty lines around module bodies.

name: Layout/EndAlignment
description: Align ends correctly.

name: Layout/EndOfLine
description: Use Unix-style line endings.

name: Layout/ExtraSpacing
description: Do not use unnecessary spacing.

name: Layout/FirstArgumentIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first argument in a method call.

name: Layout/FirstArrayElementIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first element in an array literal.

name: Layout/FirstArrayElementLineBreak
description: Checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line array.

name: Layout/FirstHashElementIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first key in a hash literal.

name: Layout/FirstHashElementLineBreak
description: Checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line hash.

name: Layout/FirstMethodArgumentLineBreak
description: Checks for a line break before the first argument in a multi-line method call.

name: Layout/FirstMethodParameterLineBreak
description: Checks for a line break before the first parameter in a multi-line method parameter definition.

name: Layout/FirstParameterIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first parameter in a method definition.

name: Layout/HashAlignment
description: Align the elements of a hash literal if they span more than one line.

name: Layout/HeredocArgumentClosingParenthesis
description: Checks for the placement of the closing parenthesis in a method call that passes a HEREDOC string as an argument.

name: Layout/HeredocIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the here document bodies.

name: Layout/IndentationConsistency
description: Keep indentation straight.

name: Layout/IndentationStyle
description: Consistent indentation either with tabs only or spaces only.

name: Layout/IndentationWidth
description: Use 2 spaces for indentation.

name: Layout/InitialIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the first non-blank non-comment line in a file.

name: Layout/LeadingCommentSpace
description: Comments should start with a space.

name: Layout/LeadingEmptyLines
description: Checks for unnecessary blank lines at the beginning of a file.

name: Layout/LineContinuationLeadingSpace
description: Use trailing spaces instead of leading spaces in strings broken over multiple lines (by a backslash).

name: Layout/LineContinuationSpacing
description: Checks the spacing in front of backslash in line continuations.

name: Layout/LineEndStringConcatenationIndentation
description: Checks the indentation of the next line after a line that ends with a string literal and a backslash.

name: Layout/LineLength
description: Checks that line length does not exceed the configured limit.

name: Layout/MultilineArrayBraceLayout
description: Checks that the closing brace in an array literal is either on the same line as the last array element, or a new line.

name: Layout/MultilineArrayLineBreaks
description: Checks that each item in a multi-line array literal starts on a separate line.

name: Layout/MultilineAssignmentLayout
description: Checks for a newline after the assignment operator in multi-line assignments.

name: Layout/MultilineBlockLayout
description: Ensures newlines after multiline block do statements.

name: Layout/MultilineHashBraceLayout
description: Checks that the closing brace in a hash literal is either on the same line as the last hash element, or a new line.

name: Layout/MultilineHashKeyLineBreaks
description: Checks that each item in a multi-line hash literal starts on a separate line.

name: Layout/MultilineMethodArgumentLineBreaks
description: Checks that each argument in a multi-line method call starts on a separate line.

name: Layout/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout
description: Checks that the closing brace in a method call is either on the same line as the last method argument, or a new line.

name: Layout/MultilineMethodCallIndentation
description: Checks indentation of method calls with the dot operator that span more than one line.

name: Layout/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLayout
description: Checks that the closing brace in a method definition is either on the same line as the last method parameter, or a new line.

name: Layout/MultilineMethodParameterLineBreaks
description: Checks that each parameter in a multi-line method definition starts on a separate line.

name: Layout/MultilineOperationIndentation
description: Checks indentation of binary operations that span more than one line.

name: Layout/ParameterAlignment
description: Align the parameters of a method definition if they span more than one line.

name: Layout/RedundantLineBreak
description: Do not break up an expression into multiple lines when it fits on a single line.

name: Layout/RescueEnsureAlignment
description: Align rescues and ensures correctly.

name: Layout/SingleLineBlockChain
description: Put method call on a separate line if chained to a single line block.

name: Layout/SpaceAfterColon
description: Use spaces after colons.

name: Layout/SpaceAfterComma
description: Use spaces after commas.

name: Layout/SpaceAfterMethodName
description: Do not put a space between a method name and the opening parenthesis in a method definition.

name: Layout/SpaceAfterNot
description: Tracks redundant space after the ! operator.

name: Layout/SpaceAfterSemicolon
description: Use spaces after semicolons.

name: Layout/SpaceAroundBlockParameters
description: Checks the spacing inside and after block parameters pipes.

name: Layout/SpaceAroundEqualsInParameterDefault
description: Checks that the equals signs in parameter default assignments have or don't have surrounding space depending on configuration.

name: Layout/SpaceAroundKeyword
description: Use a space around keywords if appropriate.

name: Layout/SpaceAroundMethodCallOperator
description: Checks method call operators to not have spaces around them.

name: Layout/SpaceAroundOperators
description: Use a single space around operators.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeBlockBraces
description: Checks that the left block brace has or doesn't have space before it.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeBrackets
description: Checks for receiver with a space before the opening brackets.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeComma
description: No spaces before commas.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeComment
description: Checks for missing space between code and a comment on the same line.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeFirstArg
description: Checks that exactly one space is used between a method name and the first argument for method calls without parentheses.

name: Layout/SpaceBeforeSemicolon
description: No spaces before semicolons.

name: Layout/SpaceInLambdaLiteral
description: Checks for spaces in lambda literals.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideArrayLiteralBrackets
description: Checks the spacing inside array literal brackets.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideArrayPercentLiteral
description: No unnecessary additional spaces between elements in %i/%w literals.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideBlockBraces
description: Checks that block braces have or don't have surrounding space. For blocks taking parameters, checks that the left brace has or doesn't have trailing space.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideHashLiteralBraces
description: Use spaces inside hash literal braces - or don't.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideParens
description: No spaces after ( or before ).

name: Layout/SpaceInsidePercentLiteralDelimiters
description: No unnecessary spaces inside delimiters of %i/%w/%x literals.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideRangeLiteral
description: No spaces inside range literals.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideReferenceBrackets
description: Checks the spacing inside referential brackets.

name: Layout/SpaceInsideStringInterpolation
description: Checks for padding/surrounding spaces inside string interpolation.

name: Layout/TrailingEmptyLines
description: Checks trailing blank lines and final newline.

name: Layout/TrailingWhitespace
description: Avoid trailing whitespace.

name: Lint/AmbiguousAssignment
description: Checks for mistyped shorthand assignments.

name: Lint/AmbiguousBlockAssociation
description: Checks for ambiguous block association with method when param passed without parentheses.

name: Lint/AmbiguousOperator
description: Checks for ambiguous operators in the first argument of a method invocation without parentheses.

name: Lint/AmbiguousOperatorPrecedence
description: Checks for expressions containing multiple binary operations with ambiguous precedence.

name: Lint/AmbiguousRange
description: Checks for ranges with ambiguous boundaries.

name: Lint/AmbiguousRegexpLiteral
description: Checks for ambiguous regexp literals in the first argument of a method invocation without parentheses.

name: Lint/ArrayLiteralInRegexp
description: Checks for an array literal interpolated inside a regexp.

name: Lint/AssignmentInCondition
description: Don't use assignment in conditions.

name: Lint/BigDecimalNew
description: `BigDecimal.new()` is deprecated. Use `BigDecimal()` instead.

name: Lint/BinaryOperatorWithIdenticalOperands
description: Checks for places where binary operator has identical operands.

name: Lint/BooleanSymbol
description: Checks for `:true` and `:false` symbols.

name: Lint/CircularArgumentReference
description: Default values in optional keyword arguments and optional ordinal arguments should not refer back to the name of the argument.

name: Lint/ConstantDefinitionInBlock
description: Do not define constants within a block.

name: Lint/ConstantOverwrittenInRescue
description: Checks for overwriting an exception with an exception result by use `rescue =>`.

name: Lint/ConstantReassignment
description: Checks for constant reassignments.

name: Lint/ConstantResolution
description: Checks that constants are fully qualified with `::`.

name: Lint/CopDirectiveSyntax
description: Checks that `# rubocop:` directives are strictly formatted.

name: Lint/Debugger
description: Checks for debugger calls.

name: Lint/DeprecatedClassMethods
description: Checks for deprecated class method calls.

name: Lint/DeprecatedConstants
description: Checks for deprecated constants.

name: Lint/DeprecatedOpenSSLConstant
description: Don't use algorithm constants for `OpenSSL::Cipher` and `OpenSSL::Digest`.

name: Lint/DisjunctiveAssignmentInConstructor
description: In constructor, plain assignment is preferred over disjunctive.

name: Lint/DuplicateBranch
description: Checks that there are no repeated bodies within `if/unless`, `case-when` and `rescue` constructs.

name: Lint/DuplicateCaseCondition
description: Do not repeat values in case conditionals.

name: Lint/DuplicateElsifCondition
description: Do not repeat conditions used in if `elsif`.

name: Lint/DuplicateHashKey
description: Checks for duplicate keys in hash literals.

name: Lint/DuplicateMagicComment
description: Checks for duplicated magic comments.

name: Lint/DuplicateMatchPattern
description: Do not repeat patterns in `in` keywords.

name: Lint/DuplicateMethods
description: Checks for duplicate method definitions.

name: Lint/DuplicateRegexpCharacterClassElement
description: Checks for duplicate elements in Regexp character classes.

name: Lint/DuplicateRequire
description: Checks for duplicate `require`s and `require_relative`s.

name: Lint/DuplicateRescueException
description: Checks that there are no repeated exceptions used in `rescue` expressions.

name: Lint/DuplicateSetElement
description: Checks for duplicate elements in Set.

name: Lint/EachWithObjectArgument
description: Checks for immutable argument given to each_with_object.

name: Lint/ElseLayout
description: Checks for odd code arrangement in an else block.

name: Lint/EmptyBlock
description: Checks for blocks without a body.

name: Lint/EmptyClass
description: Checks for classes and metaclasses without a body.

name: Lint/EmptyConditionalBody
description: Checks for the presence of `if`, `elsif` and `unless` branches without a body.

name: Lint/EmptyEnsure
description: Checks for empty ensure block.

name: Lint/EmptyExpression
description: Checks for empty expressions.

name: Lint/EmptyFile
description: Enforces that Ruby source files are not empty.

name: Lint/EmptyInPattern
description: Checks for the presence of `in` pattern branches without a body.

name: Lint/EmptyInterpolation
description: Checks for empty string interpolation.

name: Lint/EmptyWhen
description: Checks for `when` branches with empty bodies.

name: Lint/EnsureReturn
description: Do not use return in an ensure block.

name: Lint/ErbNewArguments
description: Use `:trim_mode` and `:eoutvar` keyword arguments to `ERB.new`.

name: Lint/FlipFlop
description: Checks for flip-flops.

name: Lint/FloatComparison
description: Checks for the presence of precise comparison of floating point numbers.

name: Lint/FloatOutOfRange
description: Catches floating-point literals too large or small for Ruby to represent.

name: Lint/FormatParameterMismatch
description: The number of parameters to format/sprint must match the fields.

name: Lint/HashCompareByIdentity
description: Prefer using `Hash#compare_by_identity` than using `object_id` for keys.

name: Lint/HashNewWithKeywordArgumentsAsDefault
description: Checks for the deprecated use of keyword arguments for hash default in `Hash.new`.

name: Lint/HeredocMethodCallPosition
description: Checks for the ordering of a method call where the receiver of the call is a HEREDOC.

name: Lint/IdentityComparison
description: Prefer `equal?` over `==` when comparing `object_id`.

name: Lint/ImplicitStringConcatenation
description: Checks for adjacent string literals on the same line, which could better be represented as a single string literal.

name: Lint/IncompatibleIoSelectWithFiberScheduler
description: Checks for `IO.select` that is incompatible with Fiber Scheduler.

name: Lint/IneffectiveAccessModifier
description: Checks for attempts to use `private` or `protected` to set the visibility of a class method, which does not work.

name: Lint/InheritException
description: Avoid inheriting from the `Exception` class.

name: Lint/InterpolationCheck
description: Checks for interpolation in a single quoted string.

name: Lint/ItWithoutArgumentsInBlock
description: Checks uses of `it` calls without arguments in block.

name: Lint/LambdaWithoutLiteralBlock
description: Checks uses of lambda without a literal block.

name: Lint/LiteralAsCondition
description: Checks of literals used in conditions.

name: Lint/LiteralAssignmentInCondition
description: Checks for literal assignments in the conditions.

name: Lint/LiteralInInterpolation
description: Checks for literals used in interpolation.

name: Lint/Loop
description: Use Kernel#loop with break rather than begin/end/until or begin/end/while for post-loop tests.

name: Lint/MissingCopEnableDirective
description: Checks for a `# rubocop:enable` after `# rubocop:disable`.

name: Lint/MissingSuper
description: Checks for the presence of constructors and lifecycle callbacks without calls to `super`.

name: Lint/MixedCaseRange
description: Checks for mixed-case character ranges since they include likely unintended characters.

name: Lint/MixedRegexpCaptureTypes
description: Do not mix named captures and numbered captures in a Regexp literal.

name: Lint/MultipleComparison
description: Use `&&` operator to compare multiple values.

name: Lint/NestedMethodDefinition
description: Do not use nested method definitions.

name: Lint/NestedPercentLiteral
description: Checks for nested percent literals.

name: Lint/NextWithoutAccumulator
description: Do not omit the accumulator when calling `next` in a `reduce`/`inject` block.

name: Lint/NoReturnInBeginEndBlocks
description: Do not `return` inside `begin..end` blocks in assignment contexts.

name: Lint/NonAtomicFileOperation
description: Checks for non-atomic file operations.

name: Lint/NonDeterministicRequireOrder
description: Always sort arrays returned by Dir.glob when requiring files.

name: Lint/NonLocalExitFromIterator
description: Do not use return in iterator to cause non-local exit.

name: Lint/NumberConversion
description: Checks unsafe usage of number conversion methods.

name: Lint/NumberedParameterAssignment
description: Checks for uses of numbered parameter assignment.

name: Lint/NumericOperationWithConstantResult
description: Checks for numeric operations with constant results.

name: Lint/OrAssignmentToConstant
description: Checks unintended or-assignment to constant.

name: Lint/OrderedMagicComments
description: Checks the proper ordering of magic comments and whether a magic comment is not placed before a shebang.

name: Lint/OutOfRangeRegexpRef
description: Checks for out of range reference for Regexp because it always returns nil.

name: Lint/ParenthesesAsGroupedExpression
description: Checks for method calls with a space before the opening parenthesis.

name: Lint/PercentStringArray
description: Checks for unwanted commas and quotes in %w/%W literals.

name: Lint/PercentSymbolArray
description: Checks for unwanted commas and colons in %i/%I literals.

name: Lint/RaiseException
description: Checks for `raise` or `fail` statements which are raising `Exception` class.

name: Lint/RandOne
description: Checks for `rand(1)` calls. Such calls always return `0` and most likely a mistake.

name: Lint/RedundantCopDisableDirective
description: Checks for rubocop:disable comments that can be removed. Note: this cop is not disabled when disabling all cops. It must be explicitly disabled.

name: Lint/RedundantCopEnableDirective
description: Checks for rubocop:enable comments that can be removed.

name: Lint/RedundantDirGlobSort
description: Checks for redundant `sort` method to `Dir.glob` and `Dir[]`.

name: Lint/RedundantRegexpQuantifiers
description: Checks for redundant quantifiers in Regexps.

name: Lint/RedundantRequireStatement
description: Checks for unnecessary `require` statement.

name: Lint/RedundantSafeNavigation
description: Checks for redundant safe navigation calls.

name: Lint/RedundantSplatExpansion
description: Checks for splat unnecessarily being called on literals.

name: Lint/RedundantStringCoercion
description: Checks for Object#to_s usage in string interpolation.

name: Lint/RedundantTypeConversion
description: Checks for redundantly converting a literal to the same type.

name: Lint/RedundantWithIndex
description: Checks for redundant `with_index`.

name: Lint/RedundantWithObject
description: Checks for redundant `with_object`.

name: Lint/RefinementImportMethods
description: Use `Refinement#import_methods` when using `include` or `prepend` in `refine` block.

name: Lint/RegexpAsCondition
description: Do not use regexp literal as a condition. The regexp literal matches `$_` implicitly.

name: Lint/RequireParentheses
description: Use parentheses in the method call to avoid confusion about precedence.

name: Lint/RequireRangeParentheses
description: Checks that a range literal is enclosed in parentheses when the end of the range is at a line break.

name: Lint/RequireRelativeSelfPath
description: Checks for uses a file requiring itself with `require_relative`.

name: Lint/RescueException
description: Avoid rescuing the Exception class.

name: Lint/RescueType
description: Avoid rescuing from non constants that could result in a `TypeError`.

name: Lint/ReturnInVoidContext
description: Checks for return in void context.

name: Lint/SafeNavigationChain
description: Do not chain ordinary method call after safe navigation operator.

name: Lint/SafeNavigationConsistency
description: Check to make sure that if safe navigation is used in an `&&` or `||` condition, consistent and appropriate safe navigation, without excess or deficiency, is used for all method calls on the same object.

name: Lint/SafeNavigationWithEmpty
description: Avoid `foo&.empty?` in conditionals.

name: Lint/ScriptPermission
description: Grant script file execute permission.

name: Lint/SelfAssignment
description: Checks for self-assignments.

name: Lint/SendWithMixinArgument
description: Checks for `send` method when using mixin.

name: Lint/ShadowedArgument
description: Avoid reassigning arguments before they were used.

name: Lint/ShadowedException
description: Avoid rescuing a higher level exception before a lower level exception.

name: Lint/ShadowingOuterLocalVariable
description: Do not use the same name as outer local variable for block arguments or block local variables.

name: Lint/SharedMutableDefault
description: Checks for mutable literals used as default arguments during Hash initialization.

name: Lint/StructNewOverride
description: Disallow overriding the `Struct` built-in methods via `Struct.new`.

name: Lint/SuppressedException
description: Don't suppress exceptions.

name: Lint/SuppressedExceptionInNumberConversion
description: Checks for cases where exceptions unrelated to the numeric constructors may be unintentionally swallowed.

name: Lint/SymbolConversion
description: Checks for unnecessary symbol conversions.

name: Lint/Syntax
description: Checks for syntax errors.

name: Lint/ToEnumArguments
description: Ensures that `to_enum`/`enum_for`, called for the current method, has correct arguments.

name: Lint/ToJSON
description: Ensure #to_json includes an optional argument.

name: Lint/TopLevelReturnWithArgument
description: Detects top level return statements with argument.

name: Lint/TrailingCommaInAttributeDeclaration
description: Checks for trailing commas in attribute declarations.

name: Lint/TripleQuotes
description: Checks for useless triple quote constructs.

name: Lint/UnderscorePrefixedVariableName
description: Do not use prefix `_` for a variable that is used.

name: Lint/UnescapedBracketInRegexp
description: Checks for unescaped literal `]` in Regexp.

name: Lint/UnexpectedBlockArity
description: Looks for blocks that have fewer arguments that the calling method expects.

name: Lint/UnifiedInteger
description: Use Integer instead of Fixnum or Bignum.

name: Lint/UnmodifiedReduceAccumulator
description: Checks for `reduce` or `inject` blocks that do not update the accumulator each iteration.

name: Lint/UnreachableCode
description: Unreachable code.

name: Lint/UnreachableLoop
description: Checks for loops that will have at most one iteration.

name: Lint/UnusedBlockArgument
description: Checks for unused block arguments.

name: Lint/UnusedMethodArgument
description: Checks for unused method arguments.

name: Lint/UriEscapeUnescape
description: `URI.escape` method is obsolete and should not be used. Instead, use `CGI.escape`, `URI.encode_www_form` or `URI.encode_www_form_component` depending on your specific use case. Also `URI.unescape` method is obsolete and should not be used. Instead, use `CGI.unescape`, `URI.decode_www_form` or `URI.decode_www_form_component` depending on your specific use case.

name: Lint/UriRegexp
description: Use `URI::DEFAULT_PARSER.make_regexp` instead of `URI.regexp`.

name: Lint/UselessAccessModifier
description: Checks for useless access modifiers.

name: Lint/UselessAssignment
description: Checks for useless assignment to a local variable.

name: Lint/UselessConstantScoping
description: Checks for useless constant scoping.

name: Lint/UselessDefaultValueArgument
description: Checks for usage of `fetch` or `Array.new` with default value argument and block.

name: Lint/UselessDefined
description: Checks for calls to `defined?` with strings and symbols. The result of such a call will always be truthy.

name: Lint/UselessElseWithoutRescue
description: Checks for useless `else` in `begin..end` without `rescue`.

name: Lint/UselessMethodDefinition
description: Checks for useless method definitions.

name: Lint/UselessNumericOperation
description: Checks for useless numeric operations.

name: Lint/UselessOr
description: Checks for useless OR expressions.

name: Lint/UselessRescue
description: Checks for useless `rescue`s.

name: Lint/UselessRuby2Keywords
description: Finds unnecessary uses of `ruby2_keywords`.

name: Lint/UselessSetterCall
description: Checks for useless setter call to a local variable.

name: Lint/UselessTimes
description: Checks for useless `Integer#times` calls.

name: Lint/Void
description: Possible use of operator/literal/variable in void context.

name: Metrics/AbcSize
description: A calculated magnitude based on number of assignments, branches, and conditions.

name: Metrics/BlockLength
description: Avoid long blocks with many lines.

name: Metrics/BlockNesting
description: Avoid excessive block nesting.

name: Metrics/ClassLength
description: Avoid classes longer than 100 lines of code.

name: Metrics/CollectionLiteralLength
description: Checks for `Array` or `Hash` literals with many entries.

name: Metrics/CyclomaticComplexity
description: A complexity metric that is strongly correlated to the number of test cases needed to validate a method.

name: Metrics/MethodLength
description: Avoid methods longer than 10 lines of code.

name: Metrics/ModuleLength
description: Avoid modules longer than 100 lines of code.

name: Metrics/ParameterLists
description: Avoid parameter lists longer than three or four parameters.

name: Metrics/PerceivedComplexity
description: A complexity metric geared towards measuring complexity for a human reader.

name: Migration/DepartmentName
description: Check that cop names in rubocop:disable (etc) comments are given with department name.

name: Naming/AccessorMethodName
description: Checks the naming of accessor methods for get_/set_.

name: Naming/AsciiIdentifiers
description: Use only ascii symbols in identifiers and constants.

name: Naming/BinaryOperatorParameterName
description: When defining binary operators, name the argument other.

name: Naming/BlockForwarding
description: Use anonymous block forwarding.

name: Naming/BlockParameterName
description: Checks for block parameter names that contain capital letters, end in numbers, or do not meet a minimal length.

name: Naming/ClassAndModuleCamelCase
description: Use CamelCase for classes and modules.

name: Naming/ConstantName
description: Constants should use SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE.

name: Naming/FileName
description: Use snake_case for source file names.

name: Naming/HeredocDelimiterCase
description: Use configured case for heredoc delimiters.

name: Naming/HeredocDelimiterNaming
description: Use descriptive heredoc delimiters.

name: Naming/InclusiveLanguage
description: Recommend the use of inclusive language instead of problematic terms.

name: Naming/MemoizedInstanceVariableName
description: Memoized method name should match memo instance variable name.

name: Naming/MethodName
description: Use the configured style when naming methods.

name: Naming/MethodParameterName
description: Checks for method parameter names that contain capital letters, end in numbers, or do not meet a minimal length.

name: Naming/PredicateMethod
description: Checks that predicate methods end with `?` and non-predicate methods do not.

name: Naming/PredicatePrefix
description: Predicate method names should not be prefixed and end with a `?`.

name: Naming/RescuedExceptionsVariableName
description: Use consistent rescued exceptions variables naming.

name: Naming/VariableName
description: Use the configured style when naming variables.

name: Naming/VariableNumber
description: Use the configured style when numbering symbols, methods and variables.

name: Security/CompoundHash
description: When overwriting Object#hash to combine values, prefer delegating to Array#hash over writing a custom implementation.

name: Security/Eval
description: The use of eval represents a serious security risk.

name: Security/IoMethods
description: Checks for the first argument to `IO.read`, `IO.binread`, `IO.write`, `IO.binwrite`, `IO.foreach`, and `IO.readlines`.

name: Security/JSONLoad
description: Prefer usage of `JSON.parse` over `JSON.load` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

name: Security/MarshalLoad
description: Avoid using of `Marshal.load` or `Marshal.restore` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

name: Security/Open
description: The use of `Kernel#open` and `URI.open` represent a serious security risk.

name: Security/YAMLLoad
description: Prefer usage of `YAML.safe_load` over `YAML.load` due to potential security issues. See reference for more information.

name: Style/AccessModifierDeclarations
description: Checks style of how access modifiers are used.

name: Style/AccessorGrouping
description: Checks for grouping of accessors in `class` and `module` bodies.

name: Style/Alias
description: Use alias instead of alias_method.

name: Style/AmbiguousEndlessMethodDefinition
description: Checks for endless methods inside operators of lower precedence.

name: Style/AndOr
description: Use &&/|| instead of and/or.

name: Style/ArgumentsForwarding
description: Use arguments forwarding.

name: Style/ArrayCoercion
description: Use Array() instead of explicit Array check or [*var], when dealing with a variable you want to treat as an Array, but you're not certain it's an array.

name: Style/ArrayFirstLast
description: Use `arr.first` and `arr.last` instead of `arr[0]` and `arr[-1]`.

name: Style/ArrayIntersect
description: Use `array1.intersect?(array2)` instead of `(array1 & array2).any?`.

name: Style/ArrayIntersectWithSingleElement
description: Use `include?(element)` instead of `intersect?([element])`.

name: Style/ArrayJoin
description: Use Array#join instead of Array#*.

name: Style/AsciiComments
description: Use only ascii symbols in comments.

name: Style/Attr
description: Checks for uses of Module#attr.

name: Style/AutoResourceCleanup
description: Suggests the usage of an auto resource cleanup version of a method (if available).

name: Style/BarePercentLiterals
description: Checks if usage of %() or %Q() matches configuration.

name: Style/BeginBlock
description: Avoid the use of BEGIN blocks.

name: Style/BisectedAttrAccessor
description: Checks for places where `attr_reader` and `attr_writer` for the same method can be combined into single `attr_accessor`.

name: Style/BitwisePredicate
description: Prefer bitwise predicate methods over direct comparison operations.

name: Style/BlockComments
description: Do not use block comments.

name: Style/BlockDelimiters
description: Avoid using {...} for multi-line blocks (multiline chaining is always ugly). Prefer {...} over do...end for single-line blocks.

name: Style/CaseEquality
description: Avoid explicit use of the case equality operator (`===`).

name: Style/CaseLikeIf
description: Identifies places where `if-elsif` constructions can be replaced with `case-when`.

name: Style/CharacterLiteral
description: Checks for uses of character literals.

name: Style/ClassAndModuleChildren
description: Checks style of children classes and modules.

name: Style/ClassCheck
description: Enforces consistent use of `Object#is_a?` or `Object#kind_of?`.

name: Style/ClassEqualityComparison
description: Enforces the use of `Object#instance_of?` instead of class comparison for equality.

name: Style/ClassMethods
description: Use self when defining module/class methods.

name: Style/ClassMethodsDefinitions
description: Enforces using `def self.method_name` or `class << self` to define class methods.

name: Style/ClassVars
description: Avoid the use of class variables.

name: Style/CollectionCompact
description: Use `{Array,Hash}#{compact,compact!}` instead of custom logic to reject nils.

name: Style/CollectionMethods
description: Preferred collection methods.

name: Style/CollectionQuerying
description: Prefer `Enumerable` predicate methods over expressions with `count`.

name: Style/ColonMethodCall
description: Do not use :: for method call.

name: Style/ColonMethodDefinition
description: Do not use :: for defining class methods.

name: Style/CombinableDefined
description: Checks successive `defined?` calls that can be combined into a single call.

name: Style/CombinableLoops
description: Checks for places where multiple consecutive loops over the same data can be combined into a single loop.

name: Style/CommandLiteral
description: Use `` or %x around command literals.

name: Style/CommentAnnotation
description: Checks formatting of special comments (TODO, FIXME, OPTIMIZE, HACK, REVIEW, NOTE).

name: Style/CommentedKeyword
description: Do not place comments on the same line as certain keywords.

name: Style/ComparableBetween
description: Enforces the use of `Comparable#between?` instead of logical comparison.

name: Style/ComparableClamp
description: Enforces the use of `Comparable#clamp` instead of comparison by minimum and maximum.

name: Style/ConcatArrayLiterals
description: Enforces the use of `Array#push(item)` instead of `Array#concat([item])` to avoid redundant array literals.

name: Style/ConditionalAssignment
description: Use the return value of `if` and `case` statements for assignment to a variable and variable comparison instead of assigning that variable inside of each branch.

name: Style/ConstantVisibility
description: Check that class- and module constants have visibility declarations.

name: Style/Copyright
description: Include a copyright notice in each file before any code.

name: Style/DataInheritance
description: Checks for inheritance from Data.define.

name: Style/DateTime
description: Use Time over DateTime.

name: Style/DefWithParentheses
description: Use def with parentheses when there are arguments.

name: Style/DigChain
description: Use `dig` with multiple parameters instead of chaining multiple calls.

name: Style/Dir
description: Use the `__dir__` method to retrieve the canonicalized absolute path to the current file.

name: Style/DirEmpty
description: Prefer to use `Dir.empty?('path/to/dir')` when checking if a directory is empty.

name: Style/DisableCopsWithinSourceCodeDirective
description: Forbids disabling/enabling cops within source code.

name: Style/DocumentDynamicEvalDefinition
description: When using `class_eval` (or other `eval`) with string interpolation, add a comment block showing its appearance if interpolated.

name: Style/Documentation
description: Document classes and non-namespace modules.

name: Style/DocumentationMethod
description: Checks for missing documentation comment for public methods.

name: Style/DoubleCopDisableDirective
description: Checks for double rubocop:disable comments on a single line.

name: Style/DoubleNegation
description: Checks for uses of double negation (!!).

name: Style/EachForSimpleLoop
description: Use `Integer#times` for a simple loop which iterates a fixed number of times.

name: Style/EachWithObject
description: Prefer `each_with_object` over `inject` or `reduce`.

name: Style/EmptyBlockParameter
description: Omit pipes for empty block parameters.

name: Style/EmptyCaseCondition
description: Avoid empty condition in case statements.

name: Style/EmptyClassDefinition
description: Enforces consistent style for empty class definitions.

name: Style/EmptyElse
description: Avoid empty else-clauses.

name: Style/EmptyHeredoc
description: Checks for using empty heredoc to reduce redundancy.

name: Style/EmptyLambdaParameter
description: Omit parens for empty lambda parameters.

name: Style/EmptyLiteral
description: Prefer literals to Array.new/Hash.new/String.new.

name: Style/EmptyMethod
description: Checks the formatting of empty method definitions.

name: Style/EmptyStringInsideInterpolation
description: Checks for empty strings being assigned inside string interpolation.

name: Style/Encoding
description: Use UTF-8 as the source file encoding.

name: Style/EndBlock
description: Avoid the use of END blocks.

name: Style/EndlessMethod
description: Avoid the use of multi-lined endless method definitions.

name: Style/EnvHome
description: Checks for consistent usage of `ENV['HOME']`.

name: Style/EvalWithLocation
description: Pass `__FILE__` and `__LINE__` to `eval` method, as they are used by backtraces.

name: Style/EvenOdd
description: Favor the use of `Integer#even?` && `Integer#odd?`.

name: Style/ExactRegexpMatch
description: Checks for exact regexp match inside Regexp literals.

name: Style/ExpandPathArguments
description: Use `expand_path(__dir__)` instead of `expand_path('..', __FILE__)`.

name: Style/ExplicitBlockArgument
description: Consider using explicit block argument to avoid writing block literal that just passes its arguments to another block.

name: Style/ExponentialNotation
description: When using exponential notation, favor a mantissa between 1 (inclusive) and 10 (exclusive).

name: Style/FetchEnvVar
description: Suggests `ENV.fetch` for the replacement of `ENV[]`.

name: Style/FileEmpty
description: Prefer to use `File.empty?('path/to/file')` when checking if a file is empty.

name: Style/FileNull
description: Use `File::NULL` instead of hardcoding "dev/null".

name: Style/FileRead
description: Favor `File.(bin)read` convenience methods.

name: Style/FileTouch
description: Favor `FileUtils.touch` for touching files.

name: Style/FileWrite
description: Favor `File.(bin)write` convenience methods.

name: Style/FloatDivision
description: For performing float division, coerce one side only.

name: Style/For
description: Checks use of for or each in multiline loops.

name: Style/FormatString
description: Enforce the use of Kernel#sprintf, Kernel#format or String#%.

name: Style/FormatStringToken
description: Use a consistent style for format string tokens.

name: Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment
description: Add the frozen_string_literal comment to the top of files to help transition to frozen string literals by default.

name: Style/GlobalStdStream
description: Enforces the use of `$stdout/$stderr/$stdin` instead of `STDOUT/STDERR/STDIN`.

name: Style/GlobalVars
description: Do not introduce global variables.

name: Style/GuardClause
description: Checks for conditionals that can be replaced with guard clauses.

name: Style/HashAsLastArrayItem
description: Checks for presence or absence of braces around hash literal as a last array item depending on configuration.

name: Style/HashConversion
description: Avoid Hash[] in favor of ary.to_h or literal hashes.

name: Style/HashEachMethods
description: Use Hash#each_key and Hash#each_value.

name: Style/HashExcept
description: Checks for usages of `Hash#reject`, `Hash#select`, and `Hash#filter` methods that can be replaced with `Hash#except` method.

name: Style/HashFetchChain
description: Use `Hash#dig` instead of chained `fetch` calls.

name: Style/HashLikeCase
description: Checks for places where `case-when` represents a simple 1:1 mapping and can be replaced with a hash lookup.

name: Style/HashLookupMethod
description: Enforces the use of either `Hash#[]` or `Hash#fetch` for hash lookup.

name: Style/HashSlice
description: Checks for usages of `Hash#reject`, `Hash#select`, and `Hash#filter` methods that can be replaced with `Hash#slice` method.

name: Style/HashSyntax
description: Prefer Ruby 1.9 hash syntax { a: 1, b: 2 } over 1.8 syntax { :a => 1, :b => 2 }.

name: Style/HashTransformKeys
description: Prefer `transform_keys` over `each_with_object`, `map`, or `to_h`.

name: Style/HashTransformValues
description: Prefer `transform_values` over `each_with_object`, `map`, or `to_h`.

name: Style/IdenticalConditionalBranches
description: Checks that conditional statements do not have an identical line at the end of each branch, which can validly be moved out of the conditional.

name: Style/IfInsideElse
description: Finds if nodes inside else, which can be converted to elsif.

name: Style/IfUnlessModifier
description: Favor modifier if/unless usage when you have a single-line body.

name: Style/IfUnlessModifierOfIfUnless
description: Avoid modifier if/unless usage on conditionals.

name: Style/IfWithBooleanLiteralBranches
description: Checks for redundant `if` with boolean literal branches.

name: Style/IfWithSemicolon
description: Do not use if x; .... Use the ternary operator instead.

name: Style/ImplicitRuntimeError
description: Use `raise` or `fail` with an explicit exception class and message, rather than just a message.

name: Style/InPatternThen
description: Checks for `in;` uses in `case` expressions.

name: Style/InfiniteLoop
description: Use Kernel#loop for infinite loops. This cop is unsafe if the body may raise a `StopIteration` exception.

name: Style/InlineComment
description: Avoid trailing inline comments.

name: Style/InverseMethods
description: Use the inverse method instead of `!.method` if an inverse method is defined.

name: Style/InvertibleUnlessCondition
description: Favor `if` with inverted condition over `unless`.

name: Style/IpAddresses
description: Don't include literal IP addresses in code.

name: Style/ItAssignment
description: Checks for local variables and method parameters named `it`.

name: Style/ItBlockParameter
description: Checks for blocks with one argument where `it` block parameter can be used.

name: Style/KeywordArgumentsMerging
description: When passing an existing hash as keyword arguments, provide additional arguments directly rather than using `merge`.

name: Style/KeywordParametersOrder
description: Enforces that optional keyword parameters are placed at the end of the parameters list.

name: Style/Lambda
description: Use the new lambda literal syntax for single-line blocks.

name: Style/LambdaCall
description: Use lambda.call(...) instead of lambda.(...).

name: Style/LineEndConcatenation
description: Use \ instead of + or << to concatenate two string literals at line end.

name: Style/MagicCommentFormat
description: Use a consistent style for magic comments.

name: Style/MapCompactWithConditionalBlock
description: Prefer `select` or `reject` over `map { ... }.compact`.

name: Style/MapIntoArray
description: Checks for usages of `each` with `<<`, `push`, or `append` which can be replaced by `map`.

name: Style/MapToHash
description: Prefer `to_h` with a block over `map.to_h`.

name: Style/MapToSet
description: Prefer `to_set` with a block over `map.to_set`.

name: Style/MethodCallWithArgsParentheses
description: Use parentheses for method calls with arguments.

name: Style/MethodCallWithoutArgsParentheses
description: Do not use parentheses for method calls with no arguments.

name: Style/MethodCalledOnDoEndBlock
description: Avoid chaining a method call on a do...end block.

name: Style/MethodDefParentheses
description: Checks if the method definitions have or don't have parentheses.

name: Style/MinMax
description: Use `Enumerable#minmax` instead of `Enumerable#min` and `Enumerable#max` in conjunction.

name: Style/MinMaxComparison
description: Enforces the use of `max` or `min` instead of comparison for greater or less.

name: Style/MissingElse
description: Require if/case expressions to have an else branches. If enabled, it is recommended that Style/UnlessElse and Style/EmptyElse be enabled. This will conflict with Style/EmptyElse if Style/EmptyElse is configured to style "both".

name: Style/MissingRespondToMissing
description: Checks if `method_missing` is implemented without implementing `respond_to_missing`.

name: Style/MixinGrouping
description: Checks for grouping of mixins in `class` and `module` bodies.

name: Style/MixinUsage
description: Checks that `include`, `extend` and `prepend` exists at the top level.

name: Style/ModuleFunction
description: Checks for usage of `extend self` in modules.

name: Style/ModuleMemberExistenceCheck
description: Checks for usage of `Module` methods returning arrays that can be replaced with equivalent predicates.

name: Style/MultilineBlockChain
description: Avoid multi-line chains of blocks.

name: Style/MultilineIfModifier
description: Only use if/unless modifiers on single line statements.

name: Style/MultilineIfThen
description: Do not use then for multi-line if/unless.

name: Style/MultilineInPatternThen
description: Do not use `then` for multi-line `in` statement.

name: Style/MultilineMemoization
description: Wrap multiline memoizations in a `begin` and `end` block.

name: Style/MultilineMethodSignature
description: Avoid multi-line method signatures.

name: Style/MultilineTernaryOperator
description: Avoid multi-line ?: (the ternary operator); use if/unless instead.

name: Style/MultilineWhenThen
description: Do not use then for multi-line when statement.

name: Style/MultipleComparison
description: Avoid comparing a variable with multiple items in a conditional, use Array#include? instead.

name: Style/MutableConstant
description: Do not assign mutable objects to constants.

name: Style/NegatedIf
description: Favor unless over if for negative conditions (or control flow or).

name: Style/NegatedIfElseCondition
description: Checks for uses of `if-else` and ternary operators with a negated condition which can be simplified by inverting condition and swapping branches.

name: Style/NegatedUnless
description: Favor if over unless for negative conditions.

name: Style/NegatedWhile
description: Favor until over while for negative conditions.

name: Style/NegativeArrayIndex
description: Use negative array indices instead of calculating array length minus a value. Also handles range patterns with length calculations. Recognizes preserving methods and their combinations, allowing safe replacement when the receiver matches.

name: Style/NestedFileDirname
description: Checks for nested `File.dirname`.

name: Style/NestedModifier
description: Avoid using nested modifiers.

name: Style/NestedParenthesizedCalls
description: Parenthesize method calls which are nested inside the argument list of another parenthesized method call.

name: Style/NestedTernaryOperator
description: Use one expression per branch in a ternary operator.

name: Style/Next
description: Use `next` to skip iteration instead of a condition at the end.

name: Style/NilComparison
description: Prefer x.nil? to x == nil.

name: Style/NilLambda
description: Prefer `-> {}` to `-> { nil }`.

name: Style/NonNilCheck
description: Checks for redundant nil checks.

name: Style/Not
description: Use ! instead of not.

name: Style/NumberedParameters
description: Restrict the usage of numbered parameters.

name: Style/NumberedParametersLimit
description: Avoid excessive numbered params in a single block.

name: Style/NumericLiteralPrefix
description: Use smallcase prefixes for numeric literals.

name: Style/NumericLiterals
description: Add underscores to large numeric literals to improve their readability.

name: Style/NumericPredicate
description: Checks for the use of predicate- or comparison methods for numeric comparisons.

name: Style/ObjectThen
description: Enforces the use of consistent method names `Object#yield_self` or `Object#then`.

name: Style/OneLineConditional
description: Favor the ternary operator (?:) or multi-line constructs over single-line if/then/else/end constructs.

name: Style/OpenStructUse
description: Avoid using OpenStruct. As of Ruby 3.0, use is officially discouraged due to performance, version compatibility, and potential security issues.

name: Style/OperatorMethodCall
description: Checks for redundant dot before operator method call.

name: Style/OptionHash
description: Don't use option hashes when you can use keyword arguments.

name: Style/OptionalArguments
description: Checks for optional arguments that do not appear at the end of the argument list.

name: Style/OptionalBooleanParameter
description: Use keyword arguments when defining method with boolean argument.

name: Style/OrAssignment
description: Recommend usage of double pipe equals (||=) where applicable.

name: Style/ParallelAssignment
description: Check for simple usages of parallel assignment. It will only warn when the number of variables matches on both sides of the assignment.

name: Style/ParenthesesAroundCondition
description: Don't use parentheses around the condition of an if/unless/while.

name: Style/PercentLiteralDelimiters
description: Use `%`-literal delimiters consistently.

name: Style/PercentQLiterals
description: Checks if uses of %Q/%q match the configured preference.

name: Style/PerlBackrefs
description: Avoid Perl-style regex back references.

name: Style/PreferredHashMethods
description: Checks use of `has_key?` and `has_value?` Hash methods.

name: Style/Proc
description: Use proc instead of Proc.new.

name: Style/QuotedSymbols
description: Use a consistent style for quoted symbols.

name: Style/RaiseArgs
description: Checks the arguments passed to raise/fail.

name: Style/RandomWithOffset
description: Prefer to use ranges when generating random numbers instead of integers with offsets.

name: Style/RedundantArgument
description: Checks for a redundant argument passed to certain methods.

name: Style/RedundantArrayConstructor
description: Checks for the instantiation of array using redundant `Array` constructor.

name: Style/RedundantArrayFlatten
description: Checks for redundant calls of `Array#flatten`.

name: Style/RedundantAssignment
description: Checks for redundant assignment before returning.

name: Style/RedundantBegin
description: Don't use begin blocks when they are not needed.

name: Style/RedundantCapitalW
description: Checks for %W when interpolation is not needed.

name: Style/RedundantCondition
description: Checks for unnecessary conditional expressions.

name: Style/RedundantConditional
description: Don't return true/false from a conditional.

name: Style/RedundantConstantBase
description: Avoid redundant `::` prefix on constant.

name: Style/RedundantCurrentDirectoryInPath
description: Checks for a redundant current directory in a path given to `require_relative`.

name: Style/RedundantDoubleSplatHashBraces
description: Checks for redundant uses of double splat hash braces.

name: Style/RedundantEach
description: Checks for redundant `each`.

name: Style/RedundantException
description: Checks for an obsolete RuntimeException argument in raise/fail.

name: Style/RedundantFetchBlock
description: Use `fetch(key, value)` instead of `fetch(key) { value }` when value has Numeric, Rational, Complex, Symbol or String type, `false`, `true`, `nil` or is a constant.

name: Style/RedundantFileExtensionInRequire
description: Checks for the presence of superfluous `.rb` extension in the filename provided to `require` and `require_relative`.

name: Style/RedundantFilterChain
description: Identifies usages of `any?`, `empty?`, `none?` or `one?` predicate methods chained to `select`/`filter`/`find_all` and change them to use predicate method instead.

name: Style/RedundantFormat
description: Checks for usages of `Kernel#format` or `Kernel#sprintf` with only a single argument.

name: Style/RedundantFreeze
description: Checks usages of Object#freeze on immutable objects.

name: Style/RedundantHeredocDelimiterQuotes
description: Checks for redundant heredoc delimiter quotes.

name: Style/RedundantInitialize
description: Checks for redundant `initialize` methods.

name: Style/RedundantInterpolation
description: Checks for strings that are just an interpolated expression.

name: Style/RedundantInterpolationUnfreeze
description: Checks for redundant unfreezing of interpolated strings.

name: Style/RedundantLineContinuation
description: Checks for redundant line continuation.

name: Style/RedundantParentheses
description: Checks for parentheses that seem not to serve any purpose.

name: Style/RedundantPercentQ
description: Checks for %q/%Q when single quotes or double quotes would do.

name: Style/RedundantRegexpArgument
description: Identifies places where argument can be replaced from a deterministic regexp to a string.

name: Style/RedundantRegexpCharacterClass
description: Checks for unnecessary single-element Regexp character classes.

name: Style/RedundantRegexpConstructor
description: Checks for the instantiation of regexp using redundant `Regexp.new` or `Regexp.compile`.

name: Style/RedundantRegexpEscape
description: Checks for redundant escapes in Regexps.

name: Style/RedundantReturn
description: Don't use return where it's not required.

name: Style/RedundantSelf
description: Don't use self where it's not needed.

name: Style/RedundantSelfAssignment
description: Checks for places where redundant assignments are made for in place modification methods.

name: Style/RedundantSelfAssignmentBranch
description: Checks for places where conditional branch makes redundant self-assignment.

name: Style/RedundantSort
description: Use `min` instead of `sort.first`, `max_by` instead of `sort_by...last`, etc.

name: Style/RedundantSortBy
description: Use `sort` instead of `sort_by { |x| x }`.

name: Style/RedundantStringEscape
description: Checks for redundant escapes in string literals.

name: Style/RegexpLiteral
description: Use / or %r around regular expressions.

name: Style/RequireOrder
description: Sort `require` and `require_relative` in alphabetical order.

name: Style/RescueModifier
description: Avoid using rescue in its modifier form.

name: Style/RescueStandardError
description: Avoid rescuing without specifying an error class.

name: Style/ReturnNil
description: Use return instead of return nil.

name: Style/ReturnNilInPredicateMethodDefinition
description: Checks if uses of `return` or `return nil` in predicate method definition.

name: Style/ReverseFind
description: Use `array.rfind` instead of `array.reverse.find`.

name: Style/SafeNavigation
description: Transforms usages of a method call safeguarded by a check for the existence of the object to safe navigation (`&.`). Autocorrection is unsafe as it assumes the object will be `nil` or truthy, but never `false`.

name: Style/SafeNavigationChainLength
description: Enforces safe navigation chains length to not exceed the configured maximum.

name: Style/Sample
description: Use `sample` instead of `shuffle.first`, `shuffle.last`, and `shuffle[Integer]`.

name: Style/SelectByRegexp
description: Prefer grep/grep_v to select/reject with a regexp match.

name: Style/SelfAssignment
description: Checks for places where self-assignment shorthand should have been used.

name: Style/Semicolon
description: Don't use semicolons to terminate expressions.

name: Style/Send
description: Prefer `Object#__send__` or `Object#public_send` to `send`, as `send` may overlap with existing methods.

name: Style/SendWithLiteralMethodName
description: Detects the use of the `public_send` method with a static method name argument.

name: Style/SignalException
description: Checks for proper usage of fail and raise.

name: Style/SingleArgumentDig
description: Avoid using single argument dig method.

name: Style/SingleLineBlockParams
description: Enforces the names of some block params.

name: Style/SingleLineDoEndBlock
description: Checks for single-line `do`...`end` blocks.

name: Style/SingleLineMethods
description: Avoid single-line methods.

name: Style/SlicingWithRange
description: Checks array slicing is done with redundant, endless, and beginless ranges when suitable.

name: Style/SoleNestedConditional
description: Finds sole nested conditional nodes which can be merged into outer conditional node.

name: Style/SpecialGlobalVars
description: Avoid Perl-style global variables.

name: Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses
description: Checks for the usage of parentheses around stabby lambda arguments.

name: Style/StaticClass
description: Prefer modules to classes with only class methods.

name: Style/StderrPuts
description: Use `warn` instead of `$stderr.puts`.

name: Style/StringChars
description: Checks for uses of `String#split` with empty string or regexp literal argument.

name: Style/StringConcatenation
description: Checks for places where string concatenation can be replaced with string interpolation.

name: Style/StringHashKeys
description: Prefer symbols instead of strings as hash keys.

name: Style/StringLiterals
description: Checks if uses of quotes match the configured preference.

name: Style/StringLiteralsInInterpolation
description: Checks if uses of quotes inside expressions in interpolated strings match the configured preference.

name: Style/StringMethods
description: Checks if configured preferred methods are used over non-preferred.

name: Style/Strip
description: Use `strip` instead of `lstrip.rstrip`.

name: Style/StructInheritance
description: Checks for inheritance from Struct.new.

name: Style/SuperArguments
description: Call `super` without arguments and parentheses when the signature is identical.

name: Style/SuperWithArgsParentheses
description: Use parentheses for `super` with arguments.

name: Style/SwapValues
description: Enforces the use of shorthand-style swapping of 2 variables.

name: Style/SymbolArray
description: Use %i or %I for arrays of symbols.

name: Style/SymbolLiteral
description: Use plain symbols instead of string symbols when possible.

name: Style/SymbolProc
description: Use symbols as procs instead of blocks when possible.

name: Style/TernaryParentheses
description: Checks for use of parentheses around ternary conditions.

name: Style/TopLevelMethodDefinition
description: Looks for top-level method definitions.

name: Style/TrailingBodyOnClass
description: Class body goes below class statement.

name: Style/TrailingBodyOnMethodDefinition
description: Method body goes below definition.

name: Style/TrailingBodyOnModule
description: Module body goes below module statement.

name: Style/TrailingCommaInArguments
description: Checks for trailing comma in argument lists.

name: Style/TrailingCommaInArrayLiteral
description: Checks for trailing comma in array literals.

name: Style/TrailingCommaInBlockArgs
description: Checks for useless trailing commas in block arguments.

name: Style/TrailingCommaInHashLiteral
description: Checks for trailing comma in hash literals.

name: Style/TrailingMethodEndStatement
description: Checks for trailing end statement on line of method body.

name: Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable
description: Checks for the usage of unneeded trailing underscores at the end of parallel variable assignment.

name: Style/TrivialAccessors
description: Prefer attr_* methods to trivial readers/writers.

name: Style/UnlessElse
description: Do not use unless with else. Rewrite these with the positive case first.

name: Style/UnlessLogicalOperators
description: Checks for use of logical operators in an unless condition.

name: Style/UnpackFirst
description: Checks for accessing the first element of `String#unpack` instead of using `unpack1`.

name: Style/VariableInterpolation
description: Don't interpolate global, instance and class variables directly in strings.

name: Style/WhenThen
description: Use when x then ... for one-line cases.

name: Style/WhileUntilDo
description: Checks for redundant do after while or until.

name: Style/WhileUntilModifier
description: Favor modifier while/until usage when you have a single-line body.

name: Style/WordArray
description: Use %w or %W for arrays of words.

name: Style/YAMLFileRead
description: Checks for the use of `YAML.load`, `YAML.safe_load`, and `YAML.parse` with `File.read` argument.

name: Style/YodaCondition
description: Forbid or enforce yoda conditions.

name: Style/YodaExpression
description: Forbid the use of yoda expressions.

name: Style/ZeroLengthPredicate
description: Use #empty? when testing for objects of length 0.
